content:
If anyone from the IAT implement-a-thon is interested in 400+ examples of fictional data from real EHRs (and other HIT vendors), here's a link that was used in 2018 research (presented at AMIA 2018)
https://github.com/jddamore/ccda-samples

If anyone from the IAT implement-a-thon is interested in 400+ examples of fictional data from real EHRs (and other HIT vendors), here's a link that was used in 2018 research (presented at AMIA 2018)
https://github.com/jddamore/ccda-samples

John, These samples were so help in their day. The JAMIA article that enabled we very valuable. Why is it this practice of requiring the C-CDA documents used in certification to be publicly available fell by the wayside? Do you think there is a way to put pressure on the system to follow through with a good practice they previously legislated to happen?
